title: SC_VARSITY HIGHLIGHTS FOR OCT. 24
text: SC_VARSITY HIGHLIGHTS FOR OCT. 24 Comment Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 9:34 PM Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 9:34 PM » Social News Follow us on Twitter to get story updates, sports scores and highlights of the day! MVP Rileigh Avila, GNB Voc-Tech A senior forward for the Lady Bears, Avila scored a hat trick to help fuel a 7-0 South Coast Conference girls soccer win at Wareham on Saturday. MONDAY'S GAMES Apponequet at Dighton-Rehoboth, 3:30 p.m. GNB Voc-Tech at Wreham, 3:30 p.m. Upper Cape at Westport, 3:30 p.m. Case at Old Rochester, 6 p.m. CROSS COUNTRY Diman at Old Colony, 3:30 p.m. FIELD HOCKEY Apponequet at Wareham, 3:30 p.m. Bishop Stang at Coyle-Cassidy, 3:30 p.m. Westport at Case, 3:30 p.m. Dartmouth at Needham, 4 p.m. GIRLS SOCCER Cristo Rey at Bishop Stang, 3:30 p.m. Dighton-Rehoboth at Apponequet, 3:30 p.m. Fairhaven at Coyle-Cassidy, 3:30 p.m. Old Colony at Norfolk Aggie, 3:30 p.m. Old Rochester at Case, 3:30 p.m. Westport at Upper Cape, 3:30 p.m. Mansfield at New Bedford, 6 p.m. Wareham at GNB Voc-Tech, 6:30 p.m. GIRLS SWIMMING Mount Alvernia at New Bedford, 4 p.m. GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Old Colony at Southeastern, 5 p.m. Westport at Diman, 5 p.m. Dighton-Rehoboth at Apponequet, 6 p.m. Old Rochester at Case, 6 p.m. Wareham at GNB Voc-Tech, 6 p.m. RED SOX Farrell thanks well-wishers BOSTON — John Farrell, who has been cleared to manage the Boston Red Sox next season after undergoing chemotherapy treatments and getting a clean bill of health from his doctors, is thankful for all the support he received while battling lymphoma in a leave of absence from the team. Indianapolis Colts coach Chuck Pagano and Minnesota Timberwolves coach Flip Saunders, who have both been diagnosed with cancer, called to tell him to hang in there and former Red Sox manager Terry Francona reached out to Farrell every day. But the biggest surprise was hearing from all of the Yankees fans. Although they "were very clear to say how much they didn't like the Red Sox," Farrell said, they wished him well. "I would never expect to get letters from die-hard Yankees fans," he said. "It certainly gives you a boost." FOOTBALL VMI finally wins on road MACON, Ga. — Al Cobb passed for 391 yards and two touchdowns on Saturday to lead Virginia Military Institute to a 28-21 win over Mercer that snapped a 30-game road losing streak. Cobb, who threw three interceptions, completed 28 of his 40 passes, including TD throws to Samuel Patterson and Quan Myers. Derrick Ziglar rushed for 104 yards on 22 carries, including a pair of first half touchdowns. Aaron Sanders had a school-record 16 receptions for 218 yards for VMI (2-6, 1-3 Southern), which piled up 567 total yards and won on the road for the first time since 2010. Mercer narrowed the gap to 28-21 midway through the fourth quarter when Chandler Curtis snagged a 2-yard touchdown pass from John Russ. The Bears then drove 67 yards to the VMI 25 in the closing minutes but the Keydets defense held and got the ball back on downs with 1:34 left. SUNDAY COLUMNS Pin Tales by Vicki Prevost and Open Season by Marc Folco will run in Monday's paper. southcoasttoday.com
